newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: IMF sees Venezuela 96 inflation rising to 93.8 pct.
newsitem.headline: IMF sees Venezuela 96 inflation rising to 93.8 pct.

text.p: The International Monetary Fund sees Venezuela's inflation rate rising to 93.8 percent in 1996 compared to 56.6 percent in 1995, according to a document supplied to reporters by Finance Minister Luis Raul Matos Azocar.
The IMF inflation projection was part of a presentation made by Venezuela's economic ministers to the country's top business organization Fedecamaras, Matos said.
Matos has previously said Venezuela's inflation rate will end the year at 95 percent.
A month-on-month inflation rate of 4.1 percent in August brought accumulated inflation over the last 12 months to 114.7 percent.
Planning Minister Teodoro Petkoff said earlier this week that the government would struggle to meet IMF targets on month-to-month inflation of under two percent by the end of the year.
Matos said month-on-month inflation in September would be less than August's 4.1 percent rate.
